adrFormatAddress: 101 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text: If you are trying to contact someone to help you with your housing reservations, pray you don’t come in contact with Karla Fisher. Horrible attitude, completely unhelpful, and unprofessional. Uses her personal email address and sent me 6 emails completely irreverent to my single question and it still hasn’t been answered. Good luck.

text.text: If you are trying to contact someone to help you with your housing reservations, pray you don’t come in contact with Karla Fisher. Horrible attitude, completely unhelpful, and unprofessional. Uses her personal email address and sent me 6 emails completely irreverent to my single question and it still hasn’t been answered. Good luck.

originalText.text: Housing director Kristen is very unhelpful and very unprofessional. She took months to fix small issues and has not responded to multiple of my emails. Additionally, maintenance is very slow and comes at bad times (9pm?) which makes living here very inconvenient.

text.text: Housing director Kristen is very unhelpful and very unprofessional. She took months to fix small issues and has not responded to multiple of my emails. Additionally, maintenance is very slow and comes at bad times (9pm?) which makes living here very inconvenient.

originalText.text: Second year having a student here and it has gotten better. Front desk personel are on point and student staff are very attentive. You want to feel like your kid is safe in school and they meet the criteria.

text.text: Second year having a student here and it has gotten better. Front desk personel are on point and student staff are very attentive. You want to feel like your kid is safe in school and they meet the criteria.

originalText.text:
Dirty. Unsafe environment. No meal plan. Just get an apartment and save yourself the disappointing experience.
Broken windows. Elevator broken for weeks. Rooms rented out to non-students.

originalText.text: It was dorm move in weekend and the student guides were ready! I met my son's RA, made his bed and rolled out. Looking forward to another successful year at SVA.
